channel.title: Daily Express :: World Feed
channel.description: Simply The Best 7 Days A Week

item.title: Air India baggage handling company apologises after staff seen partying days after crash
item.description: A viral video showing senior officials from Air India's partner company dancing at a staff party days after the deadly crash has caused widespread anger.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Air India plane crash, Viral news, Twitter, Air India partner, AISATS apology, viral video controversy, Air India SATS, Air India Limited, Tata Group company, SATS Ltd, airport services, lapse in judgement, disciplinary action, bodies of victims

media:content.media:description: Air India's partner company has apologised after senior officials were seen partying.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Air India's partner company has apologised after senior officials were seen partying.

item.title: Ukrainian fighter pilot ‘died like a hero’ fighting off huge Russian attack
item.description: Volodymyr Zelensky described the F-16 pilot as "one of our very best" as Russia continues to bombard Ukraine.
item.author: James Knuckey
item.media:keywords: Ukraine, Russia-Ukraine war, Russia, Volodymyr Zelensky, Aircraft, F-16, Ukraine air force, Lieutenant Colonel Maksym Ustymenko, Maksym Ustymenko

media:content.media:description: Lieutenant Colonel Maksym Ustymenko 'died like a hero', Ukraine's air force said

media:thumbnail.media:description: Lieutenant Colonel Maksym Ustymenko 'died like a hero', Ukraine's air force said

item.title: Teenage boy in serious condition after shark attack at famous beach
item.description: A teenage boy is in hospital wth serious arm injuries after a shark attack at a famous beach.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Beach, Shark, Australia, Florida, USA, Shark attack, New South Wales, Teenage boy, Cabarita Beach, Tweed Heads, Byron Bay, great white shark, 21 feet long, tourniquet, Gold Coast University Hospital, Charlize Zmuda, Boca Grande, New Smyrna Beach

media:content.media:description: A teenage boy is in hospital with serious arm injuries after a shark attack.

media:thumbnail.media:description: A teenage boy is in hospital with serious arm injuries after a shark attack.

item.title: Air India flight investigated over 'persistent warm temperature' in cabin
item.description: An Air India flight to Delhi was diverted on Sunday due to persistent cabin heat and is now under inspection.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: Flights, India, Aircraft, Plane, Japan, Air India plane crash, Air India, flight diversion, cabin temperature anomaly, Air India crash investigation, Kolkata, persistent warm temperature, passenger safety, AI357, Delhi, Mumbai Chennai-bound flight, A

media:content.media:description: An Air India was diverted on Sunday due to persistent cabin heat.

media:thumbnail.media:description: An Air India was diverted on Sunday due to persistent cabin heat.

item.title: Incredible £40 sleeper train that travels through 5 pretty European countries now running
item.description: The "scenic route" through five nations includes several stops at different cities and towns.
item.author: James Knuckey
item.media:keywords: Europe, Europe (section), Croatia, Poland, Czech Republic, Austria, Trains, Warsaw, Rijeka

media:content.media:description: The route goes from Warsaw to the Croatian port city of Rijeka (pictured) on the Adriatic coast

media:thumbnail.media:description: The route goes from Warsaw to the Croatian port city of Rijeka (pictured) on the Adriatic coast

item.title: Festival 'crowd surge' crushes three to death leaving 15 in hospital
item.description: Three people have been killed and more than a dozen hospitalised on Sunday following a sudden crowd surge at a popular Hindu festival in India.
item.author: Emily Wright,Ryan Fahey
item.media:keywords: India, Festivals (section), Accident, Air India plane crash, Rath Yatra festival, crowd surge, Puri tragedy, Odisha negligence, Hindu festival, 15 hospitalised, Puri, coastal town, three killed, fainted, suffocated, breathlesness, chariot festival

media:content.media:description: Three people have been killed and 15 hospitalised following a crowd surge at an Indian festival.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Three people have been killed and 15 hospitalised following a crowd surge at an Indian festival.

item.title: Turkey wildfire grounds all flights from popular holiday destination
item.description: Terrifying scenes have forced a major airport to ground all flights.
item.author: Charles Wade-Palmer,Adam Toms

media:content.media:description: Wildfires are causing disruption Adnan Menderes Airport.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Wildfires are causing disruption Adnan Menderes Airport.

item.title: Majorca airport chaos as fight breaks out between 'minibus drivers'
item.description: Tourists appeared shocked as violence broke out at the busy airport.
item.author: James Knuckey
item.media:keywords: Majorca, Spain, Europe, Balearic Islands, tourism, Palma, Palma de Mallorca, Palma Airport

media:content.media:description: A pair of men were filmed brawling reportedly at Palma de Mallorca Airport

media:thumbnail.media:description: A pair of men were filmed brawling reportedly at Palma de Mallorca Airport

item.title: Putin ‘preparing for NATO war’ as Russian aircraft and ship production skyrockets
item.description: Data has suggested Putin is preparing for a conflict with NATO countries, experts suggest.
item.author: Adam Toms

media:content.media:description: Data suggests Russia has ramped up production of war armaments, experts say.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Data suggests Russia has ramped up production of war armaments, experts say.

item.title: Major culture shift as France bans smoking in schools from today
item.description: France is extending its smoking ban to certain public outdoor spaces, which will be enforced in a matter of days.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: France, Smoking, Cancer, Beach, France smoking ban, outdoor public spaces, Catherine Vautrin, cultural shift, starting sunday, June 29, Official Journal, bus shelters, schools, libraries, Brigitte Bardot, Ministry of Health, £113 fine, minors, July 1

media:content.media:description: France is extending its smoking ban to certain outdoor public spaces, starting on Sunday.

media:thumbnail.media:description: France is extending its smoking ban to certain outdoor public spaces, starting on Sunday.
